page.title: 03The Liberty Family, The Lee
page.content: {The Founder} The village still shows the influence of Sir Arthur Liberty (d. 1917) who lived in The Manor from 1892. As Lord of the Manor he had the village green made, and also had many trees planted around the village. {Succession} He was succeeded by his nephew, Ivor Stewart, who took the name Stewart- Liberty and was head of the family until 1952, when much of the vast estate was sold to meet death duties and the Manor House was divided into the four homes seen today. {The Present Day} Mr. Arthur Stewart-Liberty, Ivor's son, until recently director of "Liberty's of London" and the present head of the family, lives at "Pipers" and owns Church Farm, Home Farm and Hawthorn Farm.
